moves.7... Nbd7 8. Qe2 Be7 9. O-O-O Qc7 10. g4: quite classical, but now, black are note permitted to castle, due to white pawn pressure
white decides to attack and impose a majority of pawns on queen side for the price of a knight
moves.18... axb5 19. Nxb5 Rc4 20. Bxf6 gxf6: not Bxf6: loses b7-bishop on Nxd6
moves.22... Bxd6 23. Rxd6: the pressure is higher and higher... How to stop this fabulous pawn armada?
moves.23... Ke7 24. Rd2 Rgc8 25. c4 Ra5 26. Kb: i have tried to put my rooks in a way to be able to use my only superiority: the horse. But white escapes all potential traps
moves.29... Nc5 30. e5: forces exchange, but maybe i could have let him the moves to double my rooks on b column.
moves.30... Bxg2 31. Rxg2 fxe5 32. fxe5 Rd7 33: this was not clever: as my forces are on pieces, i had to keep them all.
moves.39. Rxd3 Nxd3: of course not Rxd3: who would defend my poor horse?
moves.40... Nf4 41. Re4 Ng6: there is still nothing on Rd3+
moves.42. h5: was surprised by this move, but it prepares g5 to make h-pawn passes
moves.42... Nf8 43. b5 Nd7 44. Kb4 f6: should have made directly f5, as he cannot take en passant.
moves.45. a5 f5 46. gxf5 exf5 47. Rd4 Nxe5: and a draw... Analyses show that white had the advantage.
